description:
Implement a function that calculates the binomial coefficient C(n, k) using the standard formula. The binomial coefficient represents the number of ways to choose k objects from a set of n objects, disregarding order.

#### `Input Format:`
`The function should take two integer parameters: n and k.`

#### `Output Format:`
`The function should return an integer value representing the binomial coefficient C(n, k).`

#### `Sample Input and Output:`
#### `Example 1:`
#### `Input:`</br>
`n = 4, k = 2
#### `Output:` </br>
`6`

#### `Example 2:`
#### `Input:`</br>
`n = 5, k = 2`
#### `Output:` </br>
`10`

#### `Constraints:`
- `0 <= k <= n`
- `0 <= n <= 10^9`
title: Binomial Coefficient
